benchmark_details.name: SafetyDetect
benchmark_details.overview: SafetyDetect is a dataset designed for enabling embodied agents to detect unsafe and unsanitary situations in home environments, consisting of 1000 anomalous home scenes.
benchmark_details.data_type: scenes with unsafe or unsanitary conditions

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: The primary objective of the SafetyDetect dataset is to benchmark the ability of embodied AI agents to infer unsafe or unsanitary situations in a household setting.

data.source: Generated using the VirtualHome simulator, with added object models from various sources.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the fraction of detected anomalies and their correctness relative to user context.
methodology.interpretation: A higher AS and CAS indicates better performance in detecting unsafe or unsanitary conditions.
methodology.validation: Performance evaluated through both simulated scenarios and real-world experiments.
